intro: Schrankia angustata var. brachycarpa, commonly known as the narrowleaf Schrankia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a distinct, aromatic scent. The fruit, known as a schizocarp, splits into two mericarps upon maturity, a feature typical of the genus Schrankia.
